meanings.definition: Capable of being easily managed or controlled.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's tractability made it simple to teach him new tricks.
meanings.sent2: Her calm and tractable nature made her a great team player.
meanings.sent3: The tractability of the remote control car amused the children for hours.
meanings.sent4: His tractability in following instructions was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The tractability of the puzzle's pieces made it easy to put together.

meanings.sent1: She was so tractable that she often changed her mind based on others' opinions.
meanings.sent2: His tractability in believing everything he heard led to some funny misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The tractability of the cat to chase a laser pointer was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her tractability in agreeing with everything was like a leaf blowing in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The tractability of the student to peer pressure was concerning to the teacher.

meanings.definition: Able to be worked on or solved.
meanings.sent1: The tractability of the math problem allowed the students to solve it quickly.
meanings.sent2: The tractable nature of the software issue made it easy for the IT team to fix.
meanings.sent3: The tractability of the jigsaw puzzle made it a fun challenge for the family.
meanings.sent4: Her tractability in finding solutions to problems was like a detective on a case.
meanings.sent5: The tractability of the knot in the rope made it simple to untangle.
